long_description: KMeansPlot is a SQL-GR for assigning data points to Kmeans clusters.

input_tables.name: input1
input_tables.rDescription: Table containing the points on which to cluster the data. If an input row in the input table contains a null value, aa.kmeans.plot sets the corresponding cluster ID in the output to -1.
input_tables.description: Table containing the points on which to cluster the data. If an input row in the input table contains a null value, KMeansPlot sets the corresponding cluster ID in the output to -1.

input_tables.name: input2
input_tables.rDescription: The table which contains the centroids trained, from the kmeans function.
input_tables.description: The table which contains the centroids trained, from the kmeans function.

argument_clauses.name: CentroidsTable
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the table of cluster centroids output by the aa.kmeans function.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the table of cluster centroids output by the KMeans function.

argument_clauses.name: PrintDistance
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to print the distance between each data point and the nearest cluster. The default value is 'false'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to print the distance between each data point and the nearest cluster. The default value is 'false'.
